data.title: Linux installation packages on atom.io are broken
data.body:
## Symptoms

You downloaded Atom from https://atom.io and are experiencing unhandled exceptions like the ones in these Issues:
- https://github.com/atom/git-diff/issues/106
- https://github.com/atom/status-bar/issues/157
- https://github.com/atom/tree-view/issues/888
## Workaround
1. Uninstall the version of Atom you have installed now
2. Download the appropriate package from https://github.com/atom/atom/releases/latest
3. Install the new package according to [the installation instructions](https://github.com/atom/atom#debian-linux-ubuntu)
## Root Cause

It appears that the CDN cache on https://atom.io of the Linux packages is some unreleased branch version rather than the packages from https://github.com/atom/atom/releases/latest. We're investigating the problem and will update this Issue with current status.

data.title: Uncaught TypeError: Cannot convert undefined or null to object
data.body:

1. ...

**Atom Version**: 1.8.0
**System**: Mac OS X 10.11.5
**Thrown From**: Atom Core

data.title: trial hotfix 1.9 release
trial hotfix 1.8 release
trial hotfix for 1.8 release
why no upgrade core frame  Electron to  V1.2.7!!!!
Upgrade packages that use old versions of graceful-fs
data.body:
Bumps packages that have dependencies on graceful-fs to versions that uses graceful-fs v4 or higher. 

This is **necessary** for Node.js v6 support.

TODO:
- [x] Bump fstream.
- [x] Open PRs against [less-cache](https://github.com/atom/less-cache) â€” https://github.com/atom/less-cache/pull/10
  - [x] Bump less-cache once PRs have shipped.
- [ ] Fix regression during the `prebuild-less` task. See https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/12176#issuecomment-240339043

data.title: Broken Link in Workspace documentation
data.body:
In the documentation for the Workspace Class, the open method contains a broken link. The broken link is the "Promise" in the return values block. 
![capture 2016-06-04 at 11 15 01](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4008169/16493560/f2d6e116-3eb3-11e6-861e-17bfe98aa192.png)

_Copied from original issue: atom/atom.io#80_

data.title: double click around tabs space - editor crash after saving

data.title: Atom crashes after 5 minutes without any packages.
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [ ] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)?
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?

For more information on how to write a good [bug report](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-bug-report) or [enhancement request](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-enhancement-suggestion), see the `CONTRIBUTING` guide.
### Description

[Description of the bug or feature]
After 10 minutes of atom being open all files are unsaved and atom crashes. This even happens without packages.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. [Open Atom]
2. [Wait 10 minutes]

**Expected behavior:** [What you expected to happen]
For Atom to continue running.

**Actual behavior:** [What actually happened]
![screen shot 2016-07-14 at 3 30 04 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/14255968/16857905/e0e12636-49d7-11e6-9db1-afefc9346d4d.png)
### Versions

You can get this information from executing `atom --version` and `apm --version` at the command line. Also, please include the OS and what version of the OS you're running.

npm  2.13.3

python 2.7.10

*\* On Mac OSX El Capitan **

And here are the packages I want to use:

data.title: Clear out apm folder in cibuild
data.body: Previously, the atom master build was failing because the `apm/node_modules` folder was somehow getting into an invalid state. Probably related to https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/12170.

data.title: Project Folders are Removed When Opening Single File From Outside Project Folders
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [âˆš] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)?
- [âˆš] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [N] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [âˆš] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [âˆš] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [âˆš] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?
### Description

Atom forgets what your project folders are when you open a file outside of those
project folders. This happens to me regularly when I download a file (e.g. to my
Downloads folder) and then open it with Atom. When Atom opens, all my existing
project folders no longer appear in the editor. The downloaded file does get opened...
Then if I close/reopen Atom the project folders are still gone...
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Add some project folders to Atom
2. Close Atom
3. Open file outside of the aforementioned project folders in Atom (e.g. right click
   and say open with atom)

**Expected behavior:** I expect my project folders to not get wiped out obviously
**Actual behavior:** Project folders gone and need to be re-added
### Versions

Latest Mac OSX
Darwin 15.5.0 Darwin Kernel Version 15.5.0: Tue Apr 19 18:36:36 PDT 2016; root:xnu-3248.50.21~8/RELEASE_X86_64 x86_64

atom --version

Atom    : 1.8.0
Electron: 0.36.8
Chrome  : 47.0.2526.110
Node    : 5.1.1

apm --version

apm  1.9.2
npm  2.13.3
node 0.10.40
python 2.7.10
git 2.9.0

data.title: Atom crashes when opening a second window via command line
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)?
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?
### Description

When I already have one window of the editor open, I cannot open another window using `atom <folder_name>` in the command line.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Open a editor window (doesn't matter if there are files, can be the default `untitled` one)
2. Try to open a folder using `atom <folder_name>`

It may be worth noting that in the dock, I see another instance of Atom opening and closing quickly after running the command.  Feels like the process opens, sees an existing Atom process, and kills itself.

**Expected behavior:** A new editor window opens, with the folder specified as the project folder.

**Actual behavior:** Nothing
### Versions

Using OSX El Capitan, 10.11.5 on a Macbook Pro, with the latest stable version of Atom.

```
~
â¯ atom --version
Atom    : 1.8.0
Electron: 0.36.8
Chrome  : 47.0.2526.110
Node    : 5.1.1

~
â¯ apm --version
apm  1.9.2
npm  2.13.3
node 0.10.40
python 3.5.1
git 2.9.1
```

data.title: Stop using nodegit for now
data.body: Closes https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/12159

data.title: Syntax colouring of code blocks confused by language specifier
data.body:
### Description

The syntax colouring gets confused while editing markdown files containing code blocks with language specifier.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. create a markdown file
2. insert a code block with the three back tick syntax
3. inside the block enter a single asterisk in the middle of the code
4. insert a second code block with the three back tick syntax and follow them by a name (like cpp)
5. inside the block enter an asterisk
6. after the second block enter any text.

**Expected behavior:** 

the asterisk in the middle of the second code block should not affect the formatting.

**Actual behavior:** 

the asterisk switched formatting to italics, and this goes to the end of the file, including the final text.
### Versions

v1.8.0 running on macOS.

![screen shot 2016-07-13 at 21 10 27](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/362732/16814725/c00cd196-493f-11e6-9738-de439f97663a.png)

the GitHub syntax of highlighted code blocks is defined in

https://help.github.com/articles/creating-and-highlighting-code-blocks/

data.title: Fix bug in focusing full screen Atom from full screen terminal on macOS
data.body: fix issue #12073, the '-n' option is not needed here. Since with or without this option, atom opens up a directory in new window and a file in a new tab, given that atom is already opened. And removing the '-n' option fix the issue #12073.

data.title: UX: an inactive tab is not draggable at first click
data.body:
### Description

An inactive tab must draggable the first time i click on it. Clicking it once to activate it, and then clicking again to engage the drag is way too frustrating.
### Versions

Atom    : 1.8.0
Electron: 0.36.8
Chrome  : 47.0.2526.110
Node    : 5.1.1

data.title: Uncaught Error: EBADF: bad file descriptor, opening mounted folder
data.body:
This is thrown when I try and open a remote folder, mounted through Transmit, in Atom.
1. Mount a remote folder through SSH
   1.b (I am using Transmit)
2. Open a directory from the mounted folder (in this case `/Volumes/mountedsite.com/domains/mountedsite.com/public_html/app`)
3. Atom hangs and throws this error

**Atom Version**: 1.8.0
**System**: Mac OS X 10.10.5
**Thrown From**: Atom Core
### Stack Trace

Uncaught Error: EBADF: bad file descriptor, open '/Volumes/mountedsite.com/domains/mountedsite.com/public_html/app'

```
At /Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/workspace.js:522

Error: EBADF: bad file descriptor, open '/Volumes/mountedsite.com/domains/mountedsite.com/public_html/app'
    at Error (native)
    at Object.fs.openSync (fs.js:584:18)
    at Object.module.(anonymous function) [as openSync] (ATOM_SHELL_ASAR.js:159:20)
    at Workspace.module.exports.Workspace.openTextFile (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/workspace.js:569:27)
    at Workspace.module.exports.Workspace.openURIInPane (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/workspace.js:496:23)
    at Workspace.module.exports.Workspace.open (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/workspace.js:424:19)
    at AtomEnvironment.module.exports.AtomEnvironment.openLocations (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/atom-environment.js:1125:19)
    at EventEmitter.outerCallback (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/application-delegate.js:244:18)
    at emitThree (events.js:102:20)
    at EventEmitter.emit (events.js:175:7)
```
### Commands

```
```
### Config

``` json
{
  "core": {
    "disabledPackages": [
      "terminal-plus",
      "tokamak-terminal",
      "platformio-ide-terminal"
    ],
    "themes": [
      "one-dark-ui",
      "fairyfloss"
    ]
  }
}
```

``` coffee

emmet, v2.4.3
fairyfloss, v0.2.0
language-babel, v2.31.0

# Dev
No dev packages
```

data.title: samd21_xpro
data.body:
Hi,
I am running the latest versions of all software (win10 pro+Atom+platform+python2.7)
Everything work fine when using with arduino avr boards.
When i try to build for samd21 xpro board i have the this error:

platformio run --target upload
src\main.cpp:6:21: fatal error: Arduino.h: No such file or directory
# include "Arduino.h"

^
compilation terminated.
scons: **\* [.pioenvs\samd21_xpro\src\main.o] Error 1
 [ ERROR ] Took 1.26 seconds

Can someone help me here?

Thanks in advance, 

Alex Soares

data.title: binary payload inside shell script will break the whole file's syntax highlighting
data.body: I opened a shell script (bash script), at the tail of the file, there is binary payload (An archive). However, the shell script at head of the script will also lose syntas highlighting. Screenshot: no syntax highlight of bash script binary payload at tail: As we can see, the minimap at right side and the main window together show that the whole file has no syntax highlighting. My atom version is 1.8.0 stable, on Mac OS X 10.11.5, all the installed packages are latest:

data.title: Long line results in half-line syntax-highlighting
data.body: I opened a .sql file generated by mysqldump, in which there is very long lines. In a very long line, the syntax highlighting will be broken as the screenshot: Attention the line numbers. It's one line. A part of the line is rightly syntax-highlighted, but the other part is losing syntax-highlighting.

data.title: Remove uses of nodegit
data.body:
We're seeing crashes in Atom stable. We believe that the crashes are caused by nodegit (introduced in https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/9213). So for now, we're going to back out all of our usage of nodegit in core and bundled packages:
- [x] git-diff (https://github.com/atom/git-diff/pull/105)
- [x] fuzzy-finder (https://github.com/atom/fuzzy-finder/pull/236)
- [x] open-on-github (https://github.com/atom/open-on-github/pull/75)
- [x] status-bar (https://github.com/atom/status-bar/pull/155)

Refs https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/12153

data.title: Improve incompatible native module error message
data.body:
Decided to do the quick update to @Glavin001's #12086 so this could be merged.

Applies to #6771.

data.title: Invisibles enhancements and fixes
data.body:
In order to clean things up, I'm unifying a number of invisibles-related enhancements and fixes under this one Issue and closing the others.
- [ ] When `showInvisibles` is off, non-visible characters should be non-visible
- [ ] When `showInvisibles` is on, all normally non-visible characters (control characters, zero-width spaces, other Unicode weirdness, etc) should be rendered in some way #1839
- [ ] There should be some way of customizing which non-visible characters are displayed when `showInvisibles` is on (Perhaps by class? i.e. whitespace, control characters, Unicode groups)
- [ ] All displayed invisibles should be visible anywhere on the line when `showInvisibles` is enabled #2572
- [ ] Make it possible for invisibles tab characters to span multiple spaces #3051 (see [implementation suggestion](https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/3051#issuecomment-183003834) by @natbraun)

Related: #6669

data.title: No error message in logs or console when there's a dead socket in /tmp
data.body:
### Prerequisites

I'm currently running Atom 1.8.0 on Gentoo using the package that's on the default Gentoo portage tree. 
### Description

I had a situation where I'd run `atom` and I wouldn't get my editor. There was nothing in the `~/.atom/nohup.log`.  I repeatedly killed all my electron and atom processes. They'd show up in the `ps` list, just no editor window. 

I also attempted moving by `~/.atom` and `~/.config/Atom` out of the way. When I restarted atom, I'd only get the `nohup.log` indicating that atom has successfully started (App load time: xxxms). Per discussion on the #atom chatroom on Freenode, I tried starting it with `-l /tmp/mylog.log` (Atom didn't even create the log file) and then `atom -f` which generated no errors.

Finally, I noticed in `/tmp` I had an `atom-1.8.0-[my username].sock` after I had killed the processes. It was a dead socket. I removed it an atom started up fine. I killed it, replaced my old atom config and storage directories and it started right up.  
### Workaround

Delete the old, dead socket in `/tmp`. 
### Issue/Solution

I'm not an atom dev, so I'm not sure how the socket communication works, but I feel like there should be a means to check if the socket isn't connected to a running process and report an error if that's the case; or at least indicate something in the foreground logs. 
### Related

The only bug I could found that's related was the following:

https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/4346

I wasn't sure if I should just append to that one or open a new issue. Feel free to merge/duplicate mark this if maintainers feel it's appropriate. 
### Versions

```
$atom --version
Atom    : 1.8.0
Electron: 0.36.12
Chrome  : 47.0.2526.110
Node    : 5.1.1

$apm --version
apm  1.9.2
npm  2.13.3
node 5.1.1
python 3.4.3
git 2.7.3
```
